commit_message:
get_parser() should return a parser

This is also breaking other cliff commands (e.g. complete) that rely on
the method returning a parser as expected rather than None.

Change-Id: If145c18e1664c16d0eba49a9ac334b1e97abdb5a
(cherry picked from commit db435422f9e8a35aee813b7539a1300a9bc2a776)

subject: Provide dropdown menu which allows switching doc release
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 2394, 'name': 'Adam Spiers', 'email': 'aspiers@suse.com', 'username': 'adam.spiers'}, {'_account_id': 6547, 'name': 'Andreas Jaeger', 'email': 'jaegerandi@gmail.com', 'username': 'jaegerandi'}, {'_account_id': 9139, 'name': 'sebastian marcet', 'email': 'smarcet@gmail.com', 'username': 'smarcet'}, {'_account_id': 10278, 'name': 'Jimmy McArthur', 'email': 'jimmy@openstack.org', 'username': 'jimmymcarthur'}, {'_account_id': 10607, 'name': 'Alexandra Settle', 'email': 'a.settle@outlook.com', 'username': 'asettle'}, {'_account_id': 14482, 'name': 'Ian Y. Choi', 'email': 'ianyrchoi@gmail.com', 'username': 'ianychoi'}, {'_account_id': 15334, 'name': 'Stephen Finucane', 'display_name': 'stephenfin', 'email': 'stephenfin@redhat.com', 'username': 'sfinucan'}, {'_account_id': 17765, 'name': 'Frank Kloeker', 'email': 'f.kloeker@telekom.de', 'username': 'eumel8'}, {'_account_id': 19779, 'name': 'Chason Chan', 'display_name': 'chenxing', 'email': 'chason.chan@foxmail.com', 'username': 'chenxing'}, {'_account_id': 20156, 'name': 'Petr Kovar', 'email': 'pkovar@redhat.com', 'username': 'pmkovar'}, {'_account_id': 22165, 'name': 'caoyuan', 'email': 'cao.yingjunz@gmail.com', 'username': 'caoyuan'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 29344, 'name': 'ç½æ°¸å', 'email': 'bai.yongjun@99cloud.net', 'username': 'yj.bai'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 2394, 'date': '2019-01-03 00:21:14.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 2394, 'date': '2019-01-03 00:23:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Workflow-1

This is almost certainly incorrect as it stands.  For example, I didn't yet modify www/latest/badge.html, mainly because I didn't understand where it gets used or why there are apparently two copies of basically the same HTML in a single repository.  Also, the wording could probably be improved.

However, I'd be grateful to hear if *in principle* a change along these lines is likely to be accepted."}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2019-01-03 06:44:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

Either we get this working so that it always works - or leave it.'}, {'account_id': 2394, 'date': '2019-01-03 10:31:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

How would it be possible to get it always working?  Wouldn't that require maintaining a map which tracks reorganisations?

But what is the problem exactly with having the odd broken link in a developer-only context if the expectation of potential brokenness is clearly set?

Yes it does increase the badge size.  There is probably a simple solution for that though."}, {'account_id': 20156, 'date': '2019-01-03 15:45:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> This also makes the badge far too large.

Yes, it does. Maybe we could advertise links to supported releases in a sidebar, in a menu or in some other place that is not that visually intrusive?'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2019-01-03 17:29:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I wonder whether we really need this? It's a rare case..."}, {'account_id': 2394, 'date': '2019-01-03 18:47:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Surely it's not that rare for developers or other users of trunk to want to compare the bleeding edge with stable?  I find myself doing it frequently, which is why I got the urge to scratch this itch."}, {'account_id': 20156, 'date': '2019-01-04 13:49:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I really feel like this should be implemented as a drop-down menu similarly to what we provide on the docs.o.o front page.'}, {'account_id': 2394, 'date': '2019-01-04 15:39:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

@Petr you mean the "More Releases" dropdown?  That sounds like a great idea to me!  And it just occurred to me that in the template code we could even programmatically check for the existence of the filename for each release, and grey out that release in the dropdown if the file doesn't exist in that release.'}, {'account_id': 20156, 'date': '2019-01-04 16:13:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> @Petr you mean the "More Releases" dropdown?

Yep, that's the menu I meant. We should provide a way to navigate to other releases or maybe even translations from pages other than index / front pages for each release.'}, {'account_id': 2394, 'date': '2019-01-04 19:12:37.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 2394, 'date': '2019-01-04 19:15:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

@Petr done!  Although the HTML built in the gate won't look good due to hardcoded references to https://docs.openstack.org/common/css/deprecated-badge.css which were introduced for a good reason:

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/585516/3/www/templates/deprecated_badge.tmpl@6

although I can't help feeling that there's got to be a better way which solves both problems at once.

As a result I have no idea how to properly test the docstheme aspect of this."}, {'account_id': 2394, 'date': '2019-01-04 19:17:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Also, if this change works out OK then it should be pretty easy to reuse the same approach for switching language.'}, {'account_id': 2394, 'date': '2019-01-04 19:23:03.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 2394, 'date': '2019-01-04 20:15:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

OK, so this can be tested with the tweaked CSS using Chrome DevTool's local overrides feature:

https://developers.google.com/web/updates/2018/01/devtools#overrides

The steps are roughly:

- visit one of the built pages, e.g. http://logs.openstack.org/72/628072/3/check/build-tox-manuals-checkbuild/7d9e6a6/publish-docs/www/stein/admin/index.html

- set up an override folder in DevTools
- find deprecated-badge.css in the Sources tab
- right-click
- select "Save for overrides"
- copy and paste the new version of the file into the override

However I don't know how to test the badge on the per-project docs.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2019-01-05 06:43:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

The dropdown is very large, should it be really in the first line?

Also, let's not show the "page does not exist" lines.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2019-01-05 06:44:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

We have already on https://docs.openstack.org/rocky/ a "More releases" dropdown - why not use this on each page in the same location?'}, {'account_id': 2394, 'date': '2019-01-05 09:48:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

> The dropdown is very large, should it be really in the first line?

Please read my previous comments which explain how to test this correctly.

> Also, let's not show the "page does not exist" lines.

This will inevitably lead to a FAQ "why can't I switch to older releases?" - please can you suggest a proposal along these lines which avoids that?

> We have already on https://docs.openstack.org/rocky/ a "More releases" dropdown - why not use this on each page in the same location?

This is exactly what the commit message explains :-)'}, {'account_id': 2394, 'date': '2019-01-05 09:50:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

And BTW, the new code is heavily based on that "More releases" dropdown.  I just modified it to do what the commit message explains - i.e. keep the current location "sticky".  If you only tested this on the top-level page then I can see how you would have missed this aspect of the functionality.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2019-01-05 11:05:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Adam, I tested it on different pages. I don't think we should have two dropdowns but a single one. So, replace the existing one with your new one - and  I really suggest to remove the non-existent links."}, {'account_id': 2394, 'date': '2019-01-07 19:52:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

I like the suggestion that we move the language option up to the top banner too. It's the first thing that the users see, and would be useful.

Perhaps this is worth getting input from Jimmy? I'd like to hear what he has to say about this switcheroo.

[{'created': '2019-01-03 00:21:14.000000000', 'message': 'Suggest a redirect from latest pages to released equivalent

Currently the "under development" deprecation badge just points back
to the root of the documentation for the latest stable release, so
for example the badge at the top of

    https://docs.openstack.org/latest/user/index.html

just points to

    https://docs.openstack.org/rocky/

It's useful to be able to quickly jump from the development version of
a documentation page to its equivalent version in the latest release,
but currently this requires hand-merging the two URLs above to obtain

    https://docs.openstack.org/rocky/user/index.html

So automatically generate the link which is most likely to work, but
include a caveat that it might break if things got moved around.

Change-Id: I2498f00a6c863d078a70289a655b0aa3958325ed
'}, {'created': '2019-01-04 19:12:37.000000000', 'message': 'Provide links from latest pages to released equivalents

    https://docs.openstack.org/latest/user/index.html

just points to

    https://docs.openstack.org/rocky/

It's useful to be able to quickly jump from the development version of
a documentation page to its equivalent version in previous releases,
but currently this requires hand-merging the two URLs above to obtain

    https://docs.openstack.org/rocky/user/index.html

commit_message:
Provide dropdown menu which allows switching doc release

Currently deprecation badge headers just point back to the root of
the documentation for the latest stable release, so for example the
badge at the top of

    https://docs.openstack.org/latest/user/index.html

just points to

    https://docs.openstack.org/rocky/

It's useful to be able to quickly jump between different releases of
the same documentation page, but currently this requires hand-editing
URLs or many extra manual hops in the navigation trail.  So
automatically generate the links, but only display them if the link
target exists.

Since the main portal page for each release already had a "More
Releases" dropdown, remove that to avoid two dropdowns on the portal
pages.

Change-Id: I2498f00a6c863d078a70289a655b0aa3958325ed

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-19 03:20:23.000000000', 'message': 'Update grafana, use vendored role, and add es lb

The grafana role will now deploy and setup the grafana datasources using
the API as expected. API users will also be created for admin, viewer, editor.

The es config for grafana has been udpated to correct issues where the system
expected a publically accessible lb to handle grafana traffic back to an es
cluster. When the grafana role deploys the traefik lb will now be used within
the grafana deployment to ensure grafana is able to deploy against an es cluster.

Change-Id: Iae3a5c2ab1b98390110d37f33b074156d32bb684
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin@cloudnull.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Update grafana, use vendored role, and add es lb

The grafana role will now deploy and setup the grafana datasources using
the API as expected. API users will also be created for admin, viewer, editor.

The es config for grafana has been udpated to correct issues where the system
expected a publically accessible lb to handle grafana traffic back to an es
cluster. When the grafana role deploys the traefik lb will now be used within
the grafana deployment to ensure grafana is able to deploy against an es cluster.

Change-Id: Iae3a5c2ab1b98390110d37f33b074156d32bb684
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin@cloudnull.com>

commit_message:
Disable verification for Keystone session in Swift

The swift backend did not make use of the insecure option in
the config when creating a Keystone session, enable or disable
verification based on it.

Co-Authored-By: Steve Kowalik <steven@wedontsleep.org>
Change-Id: Ic783afde7ae8af522480996fdf91ed54e02e72d2
Closes-Bug: #1606268

commit_message:
use rpc from neutron-lib

We recently removed nenutron.common.rpc [1] as the rpc module lives in
neutron-lib now. This project was missed because I didn't find
neutron.common.rpc as an import.

This patch switches rpc uses over to neutron-lib.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/634790/

This commit includes a part of the following commit
to pass the gate.
----------------------------------------
Fix zuul job failures

Fix zuul job failures

Change-Id: I1d073b8c58e32669ecf6932512b94c8a2cabf70e
----------------------------------------

Co-Authored-By: Deepak Tiwari <deepak.tiwari@aricent.com>
Change-Id: I053b5c56594e1a914143a2308fef77349dfa7ea4

commit_message:
Use oslo.privsep for 'lvcreate'

Use olso.privsep rather than oslo.rootwrap for the 'lvcreate'

Change-Id: I9e8f74ef74ef3f7cbbcf7967304246e9dfafb5c0
Signed-off-by: Charles Short <chucks@redhat.com>

commit_message:
add python 3.7 unit test job

This is a mechanically generated patch to add a unit test job running
under Python 3.7.

See ML discussion here [1] for context.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-October/135626.html

Change-Id: Ib79d3d2bfe52ae0112fd326b0dff07a56ee2bde7
Story: #2004073

Why do you want to switch to internal instead of public? Most deployments could then run just with a single endpoint.

The option to use the internal endpoint instead should be kept, but it shouldn't be the default IMO."}, {'account_id': 16137, 'date': '2019-01-25 14:10:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

I agree with Jens, as somebody who's skeptic to endpoint types and now that "admin" is pretty much gone, "public" makes more sense than "internal" which is what we changed to in Puppet [1]. This doesn't reflect the actual Keystone side much and I understand there are issues when deploying different network for different endpoint types.

In an ideal world internal would disappear and there would only be one endpoint type left, which would then be removed.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/632520/'}, {'account_id': 10873, 'date': '2019-02-19 14:35:18.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

Won't have time to continue this work."}]

commit_message:
Make default interface 'internal' instead of 'admin'

With keystone v2.0 not being supported anymore, there is no longer the
need to default to the 'admin' endpoint as before. So instead, this
defaults to the 'internal' one. Easing the transition towards getting
rid of the admin endpoint.

Depends-On: I0d70f7779d5c35c55125e849e5de3e9b55b4708f
Change-Id: I590f12293d6a22c2929b78abfa20ca7654e2d7a1

subject: Add wsrep-slave-threads config with default of 48
messages:
[{'account_id': 21107, 'date': '2018-08-23 10:40:44.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 21107, 'date': '2018-08-24 05:08:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

charm-recheck

charm-single failure appears due to
> returned unexpected status: 403; error info: {"forbidden": {"message": "Quota exceeded for ram: Requested 1536, but already used 523264 of 524288 ram", "code": 403}}'}, {'account_id': 2424, 'date': '2018-09-04 14:59:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

can we make this config available to be set on the fly (SET GLOBAL wsrep_slave_threads = n;) so productions environments don't see a massive reconnect and eventually leaving things in a non so consistent state.

I know this opens the can of worms to evaluate other config options we already have, but considering this is aiming performance issues it will be common that this will be changed many times and once there are already connections open to the database."}, {'account_id': 21107, 'date': '2018-09-06 09:33:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> can we make this config available to be set on the fly (SET GLOBAL
 > wsrep_slave_threads = n;) so productions environments don't see a
 > massive reconnect and eventually leaving things in a non so
 > consistent state.
 > 
 > I know this opens the can of worms to evaluate other config options
 > we already have, but considering this is aiming performance issues
 > it will be common that this will be changed many times and once
 > there are already connections open to the database.

I agree that this functionality would be great, but from what I can see there is no existing infrastructure to handle this.

Do you think it would be reasonable to push this to a separate work task? As it will probably be somewhat complex, e.g. trying to figure out when to override the handling of restart + trying to convert the config file into "SET GLOBAL" style operations which is not always 1:1 - for example in the config file you can set a value to "100M" but in the console you have to calculate it as 100*1024*1024. So I think this would be non trivial and this change is worth getting in for at least new deployments.

We could perhaps add a warning to the config text that it will result in a restart of all nodes.

On a related note the current restart handling is also poor, it simply waits 30 seconds between nodes. That is fine in DEV but in real environments it can take longer than 30s for restarts to complete. It probably needs some logic to basically wait for the other nodes to be back before doing the restart. But again that could be a separate item.'}, {'account_id': 21107, 'date': '2019-02-19 14:33:42.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Already merged in Ib275cae0db02e4c8c0a85fcc8cb138b26eb26982 except for the default of 48'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-08-23 10:40:44.000000000', 'message': 'Add wsrep-slave-threads config with default of 48

Percona 5.7+ is capable of group commiting multiple transactions to disk
with a single sync if they are committed in parallel. The existing
default wsrep-slave-threads=1 does not allow this to happen on the slave
as only a single transaction is executed at a time and does not complete
until the sync has.

In practice, this limit was hit with medium sized OpenStack deployments
making use of the Designate service which can easily perform 10s of
transactions per second and hit the IOPS limit for a HDD. HDD workloads
will benefit most obviously from this change however SSD workloads may
also see reduced IOPS under high parallel query loads. Unfortunately no
such optimisation exists in Percona 5.6 and you will need to configure
tuning-level=fast instead if you are hit by this limitation.

Increase the default wsrep-slave-threads to 48 which experimentally is
found to be a good number for both benchmark and openstack workloads
making parallel updates even when consuming less than a single CPU core
of CPU time.

Allow configuration of the option so that it can also be tuned if
required on deployments that require it however it should not be
necessary in most cases and the configuration text informs the user of
that.

You can evaluate the performance of this change using the following
command on a HDD deployment:
mysqlslap --concurrency=100 --iterations=1 --number-int-cols=1 \
  --number-char-cols=0 --auto-generate-sql-execute-number=100 \
  --auto-generate-sql-unique-query-number=10 \
  --auto-generate-sql-load-type=update --auto-generate-sql -u root -p \
  --auto-generate-sql-add-autoincrement

On the particular system used for this benchmark the transaction rate
increased from around 13 updates/s with 13 fsyncs/s to 180 updates/s
with 26 fsyncs/s. A similar increase was seen on production systems with
openstack+designate deployments.

Change-Id: I1881b8408e104416e14fdb3d20d11f0089317195
'}]
commit_message:
Add wsrep-slave-threads config with default of 48

Percona 5.7+ is capable of group commiting multiple transactions to disk
with a single sync if they are committed in parallel. The existing
default wsrep-slave-threads=1 does not allow this to happen on the slave
as only a single transaction is executed at a time and does not complete
until the sync has.

In practice, this limit was hit with medium sized OpenStack deployments
making use of the Designate service which can easily perform 10s of
transactions per second and hit the IOPS limit for a HDD. HDD workloads
will benefit most obviously from this change however SSD workloads may
also see reduced IOPS under high parallel query loads. Unfortunately no
such optimisation exists in Percona 5.6 and you will need to configure
tuning-level=fast instead if you are hit by this limitation.

Increase the default wsrep-slave-threads to 48 which experimentally is
found to be a good number for both benchmark and openstack workloads
making parallel updates even when consuming less than a single CPU core
of CPU time.

Allow configuration of the option so that it can also be tuned if
required on deployments that require it however it should not be
necessary in most cases and the configuration text informs the user of
that.

You can evaluate the performance of this change using the following
command on a HDD deployment:
mysqlslap --concurrency=100 --iterations=1 --number-int-cols=1 \
  --number-char-cols=0 --auto-generate-sql-execute-number=100 \
  --auto-generate-sql-unique-query-number=10 \
  --auto-generate-sql-load-type=update --auto-generate-sql -u root -p \
  --auto-generate-sql-add-autoincrement

On the particular system used for this benchmark the transaction rate
increased from around 13 updates/s with 13 fsyncs/s to 180 updates/s
with 26 fsyncs/s. A similar increase was seen on production systems with
openstack+designate deployments.

Change-Id: I1881b8408e104416e14fdb3d20d11f0089317195

[{'created': '2019-02-15 09:31:03.000000000', 'message': "Skip exception in case kuryrnetpolicy CRD is already deleted

As kuryrnetpolicy CRD objects are namespaced, when a namespace is
deleted, the object is deleted by kubernetes as part of the namespace
deletion process. This was making network policy driver failing on
releasing the network policy as it could not find the object. This
patch ensures kuryr-controller doesn't fail in case kubernetes has
already deleted the kuryrnetpolicy object by skipping the exception
when trying to delete an already deleted object.

Closes-Bug: 1816020
Change-Id: I0443b65e5d6897c5d6673c222fc50101c244cd1e

commit_message:
Skip exception in case kuryrnetpolicy CRD is already deleted

As kuryrnetpolicy CRD objects are namespaced, when a namespace is
deleted, the object is deleted by kubernetes as part of the namespace
deletion process. This was making network policy driver failing on
releasing the network policy as it could not find the object. This
patch ensures kuryr-controller doesn't fail in case kubernetes has
already deleted the kuryrnetpolicy object by skipping the exception
when trying to delete an already deleted object.

Closes-Bug: 1816020
Change-Id: I0443b65e5d6897c5d6673c222fc50101c244cd1e

[{'created': '2019-02-18 22:21:40.000000000', 'message': "Devstack - run vbmc as sudo

On CentOS 7 following the documentatition to set up ironic
in devstack I keep getting permission error because for some
reason the $HOME is root's home.

[Errno 13] Permission denied: '/root/.vbmc'

The permission issue causes various error's when trying to
re-stack and unstack.

Also, kill all vbmc processes after cleanup-nodes.

Change-Id: I92683dc9345825671310e199d0a6e36bdc462ed0
"}, {'created': '2019-02-19 10:22:05.000000000', 'message': "Devstack - run vbmc as sudo

On CentOS 7 following the documentatition to set up ironic
in devstack I keep getting permission error because for some
reason the $HOME is root's home.

[Errno 13] Permission denied: '/root/.vbmc'

The permission issue causes various error's when trying to
re-stack and unstack.

Also, kill all vbmc processes after cleanup-nodes.

Change-Id: I92683dc9345825671310e199d0a6e36bdc462ed0
"}]
commit_message:
Devstack - run vbmc as sudo

On CentOS 7 following the documentatition to set up ironic
in devstack I keep getting permission error because for some
reason the $HOME is root's home.

[Errno 13] Permission denied: '/root/.vbmc'

The permission issue causes various error's when trying to
re-stack and unstack.

Also, kill all vbmc processes after cleanup-nodes.

Change-Id: I92683dc9345825671310e199d0a6e36bdc462ed0

commit_message:
Make sure we pick flavors with disk

Modern nova disallows booting vms on flavors with disk: 0 unless
they are volume backed.

Change-Id: I527a607ba71d027daa9ac2553275f849fce1244a

commit_message:
Add job for releasenotes

With changeset [1], releasenotes are added to monasca-persister. To
make the release notes available, the notes can be build now with
tox ("tox -e releasenotes") and the standard zuul
job (release-notes-jobs-python3) was added to build and publish the
notes.
Also adjust elasticsearch requirement to "<3.0.0" to be inline with
the global-requirements list. This fixes:

  Requirement for package elasticsearch excludes a version not excluded
  in the global list.

[1] Ida11c326b3e6771b5ccf994205c55874db05bc5c

Change-Id: I16268797151a6b997610c8fbded4c9eeb9265597

commit_message:
Fix python3 processing out subprocess output

Fix bug where comparison failed on python3 because subprocess returns
bytes instead of string. New lines parameter assues that the result
will be string and not bytes.

WARNING: Unsupported platform 'b'fedora28'' detected by tripleo-repos,
centos7 will be used unless you use CLI param to change it.

Change-Id: Ibff584b14b69de8eadc8391eb4b6db80469e42d6

This isn't really friendly when you want to debug issues with this service.

This patches ensures HAProxy logs are in a dedicated file, using the syslog

commit_message:
Ensure we get dedicated logging file for HAProxy

With the current configuration, HAProxy logs are in the host journal.
This isn't really friendly when you want to debug issues with this service.

This patches ensures HAProxy logs are in a dedicated file, using the syslog
facility set in its configuration.

Closes-Bug: #1814880
Depends-On: I8fee040287940188f6bc6bc35bdbdaf6c234cbfd
Change-Id: Ia615ac07d0c559deb65e307bb6254127e989794d
(cherry picked from commit 0576e26234206ab36b161cd43e6b2b69daf49948)

commit_message:
Make container build job voting

In order to prevent us from merging changes in tripleo-common that break
container builds using the current promoted code, we need to make this
job voting.

Related-Bug: #1813998
Related-Bug: #1813176
Change-Id: If984dbd9c35e599bd13e52ed8df8d3386e36eb82

There's something wrong here, we shouldn't need to fetch an object in it's on_present event. The correct pattern would be to wait until the object is filled with everything we need. What am I missing? :D"}, {'account_id': 27032, 'date': '2019-02-07 10:54:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

> (4 comments)
 > 
 > There's something wrong here, we shouldn't need to fetch an object
 > in it's on_present event. The correct pattern would be to wait
 > until the object is filled with everything we need. What am I
 > missing? :D

Thanks for the review, Michal.

The endpoint handler might start processing before the service handler finishes its job. Also, I don't think there's any condition on the endpoint handler side that can be evaluated in order to raise a 'resourceNotReady' exception to fetch the updated endpoint, since it's not doable to assure that the right SG is being used."}, {'account_id': 27032, 'date': '2019-02-07 10:54:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 23567, 'date': '2019-02-07 12:14:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

> (3 comments)

I am still getting the endpoints directly from the k8s API, because even though I added a check to raise resourceNotReady when the right spec is not used, the endpoint being captured on the on_present is never the update one, so by getting from the API and raising the exception the right version is assured.'}, {'account_id': 27032, 'date': '2019-02-08 15:24:17.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 11600, 'date': '2019-02-08 17:25:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review-1

[{'created': '2019-02-05 21:05:27.000000000', 'message': "Fix SG rules on targetPort update

After creating a NP and updating a existent service with all 'targetPorts'
allowed by the policy, the SG rules are not created with the required
'remote_ip_prefix'. Also, when the service is again updated with a
'targetPort' that is not allowed by the policy the respective SG rule
is not deleted.
This commit fixes the issue by associating 'targetPort' to the ports object
that is compared to verify whether changes occured. And, since
the SG of the LBaaS Spec is the one being updated on any changes that may
occur on the service, it will be used as the base to update the rules, instead
of using the SG from the LBaaS state.

TODOS:
- Create Launchpad Bug
- Fix unittests
- Add explanatory notes

Change-Id: Ifcdd1889a813c1eb078064facfb2ede83a179887

"}, {'created': '2019-02-18 10:05:50.000000000', 'message': "Fix SG rules on targetPort update

After applying a Network Policy and updating an existent Service so that
all 'targetPorts' are allowed by the policy, the SG rules are not being
created with the required 'remote_ip_prefix'. Also, when the service is
again updated with a 'targetPort' that is not allowed by the policy the
respective SG rule is not deleted.
This commit fixes the issue by associating 'targetPort' field to the 
'LBaaSPortSpec' versioned object, which allows Kuryr to accounts for
changes in not only 'name', 'port' and 'protocol' Kubernetes services'
fields, but also 'targetPorts'. In addition, the LBaaS SG from the
LBaaS state annotation is updated to match the SG stated in the
LBaaS spec annotation, which has the updated SG to be applied.

Closes-Bug: #1814920
Change-Id: Ifcdd1889a813c1eb078064facfb2ede83a179887
"}]
commit_message:
Fix SG rules on targetPort update

After applying a Network Policy and updating an existent Service so that
all 'targetPorts' are allowed by the policy, the SG rules are not being
created with the required 'remote_ip_prefix'. Also, when the service is
again updated with a 'targetPort' that is not allowed by the policy the
respective SG rule is not deleted.
This commit fixes the issue by associating 'targetPort' field to the 
'LBaaSPortSpec' versioned object, which allows Kuryr to accounts for
changes in not only 'name', 'port' and 'protocol' Kubernetes services'
fields, but also 'targetPorts'. In addition, the LBaaS SG from the
LBaaS state annotation is updated to match the SG stated in the
LBaaS spec annotation, which has the updated SG to be applied.

Closes-Bug: #1814920
Change-Id: Ifcdd1889a813c1eb078064facfb2ede83a179887

commit_message:
Add 'hostname' to port's local link connection

In order to create Smart NIC port, port argument is-smartnic
should be used in addition to local link connection attributes
'port_id' and 'hostname'.

Story: #2003346
Change-Id: I95d6e5d53eb6df8468748ed223bf947da5212b6e

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-15 16:03:53.000000000', 'message': 'Fix notification about arp entries for dvr routers

In method _generate_arp_table_and_notify_agent in neutron.db.l3_dvr_db
module notifiations about arp table was send only to one router
connected to subnet.
Now it will check if subnet is connected to more than one
dvr router and will send same notification to all such routers.

Closes-Bug: #1815913

Change-Id: I6a7d7f6645a8a7b5219788d51e17d54844d145bc
(cherry picked from commit 1f104a093c1f27ddb1967e72cd452d43120b4cc2)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix notification about arp entries for dvr routers

In method _generate_arp_table_and_notify_agent in neutron.db.l3_dvr_db
module notifiations about arp table was send only to one router
connected to subnet.
Now it will check if subnet is connected to more than one
dvr router and will send same notification to all such routers.

Closes-Bug: #1815913

Change-Id: I6a7d7f6645a8a7b5219788d51e17d54844d145bc
(cherry picked from commit 1f104a093c1f27ddb1967e72cd452d43120b4cc2)

What's the reason for this revert?"}, {'account_id': 12393, 'date': '2019-02-15 13:00:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Tripleo overcloud deployment is timing out because of this https://logs.rdoproject.org/openstack-periodic/git.openstack.org/openstack-infra/tripleo-ci/master/periodic-tripleo-ci-centos-7-multinode-1ctlr-featureset016-master/622f9f3/logs/undercloud/var/log/containers/mistral/engine.log.txt.gz?level=ERROR , We are testing it in RDO ci"}, {'account_id': 21970, 'date': '2019-02-15 13:03:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Are you sure? This patch just prevents lists from being tuplified. The length of the sequence should not change.'}, {'account_id': 12393, 'date': '2019-02-15 13:04:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

 > The length of the sequence should not change.

The job is still running, once it completes, I will share the result link here.'}, {'account_id': 12393, 'date': '2019-02-15 15:33:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

The overcloud deployment is passing now on applying the revert https://logs.rdoproject.org/43/13943/82/check/periodic-tripleo-ci-centos-7-multinode-1ctlr-featureset016-master/4b53345/job-output.txt.gz#_2019-02-15_14_22_17_063214

can we merge this?'}, {'account_id': 12393, 'date': '2019-02-15 16:16:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Sorry, If I am testing without revert the deployment is also passing, 
https://logs.rdoproject.org/49/18749/3/check/periodic-tripleo-ci-centos-7-multinode-1ctlr-featureset016-master/5873fce/job-output.txt.gz#_2019-02-15_14_49_44_071880

In both jobs, https://github.com/openstack/mistral/commit/58d6634702014eb3c2bf70dbe487fe5983cef8e9 commit is used,
check https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1816026/comments/8'}, {'account_id': 12393, 'date': '2019-02-18 08:02:43.000000000', 'content': 'Restored

https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1816026/comments/8 -> in promotion pipeline https://github.com/openstack/mistral/commit/a39db2d3dc21afbe8b9e1d6f8dd870da272b9671 leading to timedout.so restoring it'}, {'account_id': 8731, 'date': '2019-02-18 08:54:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Chandan, how do you relate the failure to this patch? Can you explain details?'}, {'account_id': 8731, 'date': '2019-02-18 08:55:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I see no evidence yet that there's a connection."}, {'account_id': 8731, 'date': '2019-02-18 09:01:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

-1 until there's more evidence that this is related. All that this patch does is removing tuplifying of lists in a data context for an expression so that they remain lists."}, {'account_id': 12393, 'date': '2019-02-18 11:50:56.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

will be fixed by https://review.openstack.org/637522 as per the conversation from irc. Thanks Renat for the review.'}, {'account_id': 8731, 'date': '2019-02-19 10:27:00.000000000', 'content': 'Restored

We decided to restore the revert because the original patch breaks list comparisons which looks a worse problem when the function "str" giving a wrong representation of lists.

We'll keep thinking on a better solution to fix "str" function.'}, {'account_id': 8731, 'date': '2019-02-19 10:27:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 9712, 'date': '2019-02-19 10:34:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

subject: Maintenance: Re-create the metadata port
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 5756, 'name': 'Terry Wilson', 'email': 'twilson@redhat.com', 'username': 'otherwiseguy'}, {'_account_id': 6773, 'name': 'Lucas Alvares Gomes', 'email': 'lucasagomes@gmail.com', 'username': 'lucasagomes'}, {'_account_id': 8788, 'name': 'Miguel Angel Ajo', 'email': 'mangelajo@redhat.com', 'username': 'mangelajo'}, {'_account_id': 19118, 'name': 'Eran Kuris', 'email': 'ekuris@redhat.com', 'username': 'ekuris'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23804, 'name': 'Daniel Alvarez', 'email': 'dalvarez@redhat.com', 'username': 'dalvarez'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2019-02-12 11:43:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 23804, 'date': '2019-02-12 11:48:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 23804, 'date': '2019-02-12 11:50:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: -Code-Review'}, {'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2019-02-12 11:50:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 23804, 'date': '2019-02-12 11:52:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 19118, 'date': '2019-02-13 07:36:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 5756, 'date': '2019-02-15 15:42:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

Just a question: if it's been 'wrongly deleted', would it be possible to keep it from being deleted instead of things maybe being broken for 30 minutes? If it isn't possible to keep it from being deleted, could we create an ovsdb event specifically watching for that port to be deleted, then when that event fires recreate the port?

Just -1-ing temporarily until you respond. I will be happy to +2 after if this turns out to be the best solution."}, {'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2019-02-15 16:29:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> Just a question: if it's been 'wrongly deleted', would it be
 > possible to keep it from being deleted instead of things maybe
 > being broken for 30 minutes? If it isn't possible to keep it from
 > being deleted, could we create an ovsdb event specifically watching
 > for that port to be deleted, then when that event fires recreate
 > the port?
 > 
 > Just -1-ing temporarily until you respond. I will be happy to +2
 > after if this turns out to be the best solution.

Good stuff. So, I've first thought about preventing the deletion by adding a conditional in the delete_port_precommit() method and if it was a metadata port I would raise an error. But, I couldn't figure out a way to differentiate whether this port is being deleted via an API request or just being deleted for another reason (for example when u delete the network the ports which the provider is DEVICE_OWNER_DHCP, which a metadata port is, will be automatically deleted [0]).

I thought about the OVSDB event as well but I was afraid it may race. Cause if u look at the Neutron [0] implementation. Again, when the network is deleted it will first delete the ports and then delete the network. So I was a bit afraid that it may race there (maybe that wouldn't be a problem ? I can try).

Then I came up with this maintenance method there because it mimics what the ml2/ovs driver would do, which is recreate those at the restart of the services. But also added the 30 minutes check just in case for OVN.

Lemme try the OVSDB event as well cause I think it would probably be better (and faster).

https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/1f104a093c1f27ddb1967e72cd452d43120b4cc2/neutron/db/db_base_plugin_v2.py#L466-L476"}, {'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2019-02-15 16:30:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow-1

I will play with the OVSDB event idea.'}, {'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2019-02-15 17:13:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> I will play with the OVSDB event idea.

@Terry, I've tried to create it using the OVSDB event but, as I was afraid, it did race: http://paste.openstack.org/show/745170/

Perhaps we can remove the 30 minutes thing (I don't know how useful that would be) and instead just recreate the port at startup time (as we would have ml2/ovs). What u think ?"}, {'account_id': 23804, 'date': '2019-02-15 17:45:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: -Code-Review

I wouldn't worry *too much* about the recreation of the port. If we compare to Neutron DHCP Agent, what happens? Do we need to restart Neutron DHCP Agent and wait for a full sync or they'll get recreated straight away (I vaguely remember that it was the latter but not sure)?
The metadata port can be deleted by the owner of the network but it'll be a way of shooting on their own foot. If we can fix it, then it's fine but if we're going to maintain a whole bunch of complex code, I'd rethink it :P
My two cents :)"}, {'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2019-02-16 09:22:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> I wouldn't worry *too much* about the recreation of the port. If we
 > compare to Neutron DHCP Agent, what happens? Do we need to restart
 > Neutron DHCP Agent and wait for a full sync or they'll get
 > recreated straight away (I vaguely remember that it was the latter
 > but not sure)?
 > The metadata port can be deleted by the owner of the network but
 > it'll be a way of shooting on their own foot. If we can fix it,
 > then it's fine but if we're going to maintain a whole bunch of
 > complex code, I'd rethink it :P
 > My two cents :)

Yeah I think it's fair enough, this is definitely not a serious problem. I was working on it cause it's one of the tests that we have for the automation backlog. 

But anyway, I think that fixing the port at the start up (as ml2/ovs does) for now should be enough. I will change the patch to do it and we keep it simple."}, {'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2019-02-16 09:24:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2019-02-17 15:55:28.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 5756, 'date': '2019-02-18 16:18:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 23804, 'date': '2019-02-19 09:55:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
Maintenance: Re-create the metadata port

This patch adds a new task to the maintenance thread which re-creates
the metadata port in case it's been wrongly deleted (by whatever
reasons). The task will run immediately at service restart and fix those
ports, just like ml2/ovs would do with the DHCP ports.

Closes-Bug: #1813939
Change-Id: I0819c2b956dd41c8fe59a2b1b4fec9d229afb067
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>

commit_message:
add tripleo scenario004 to experimental queue

A recent change [1] in master added a tripleo scenario004
job to the experimental queue so we can run it before merging
changes that might affect downstream tripleo CI.  We can't
cherry-pick that change because that scenario isn't supported
on single node CI in stable/rocky.

Here we add a multinode version of that scenario.

Change-Id: I2743ce3c472d940c23baf3955e09a81427e381e1
(cherry picked from commit 6510f79111376c8b05b40ae3ef22d41867882577)

subject: The id and track id use different value
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-19 08:49:01.000000000', 'message': 'The id and track id use different value

The row data could be updated depend on track id,
and id could be as the identity of the row.
The table row checkbox bind to the model value by
the id.
Track id is "image_id"_"updated_time" of the associated
case, and it will be changed when the row updated.
So, the check status of the checkbox will be lost for
id equals track id. And the batch delete button also
could delete the images selected before.
This commit difference the id and track id, and id will
not be changed when update.

Change-Id: Icd3ad4c43e389f2d65389a53351d6f9ef666a341
Closes-Bug: #1816531
'}]
commit_message:
The id and track id use different value

The row data could be updated depend on track id,
and id could be as the identity of the row.
The table row checkbox bind to the model value by
the id.
Track id is "image_id"_"updated_time" of the associated
case, and it will be changed when the row updated.
So, the check status of the checkbox will be lost for
id equals track id. And the batch delete button also
could delete the images selected before.
This commit difference the id and track id, and id will
not be changed when update.

Change-Id: Icd3ad4c43e389f2d65389a53351d6f9ef666a341
Closes-Bug: #1816531

subject: Iterate over list of values of PPC packages dict
messages:
[{'account_id': 28008, 'date': '2019-02-15 19:10:27.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2019-02-18 09:53:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

Thanks for this - I don't really understand the change, but trust that you have tested it. To be honest, I think it might be better for us to remove the download of extra packages because these are very dated and I doubt they're maintained. I suspect it may be simpler to have non-x86_64 platforms just use an alternative SST method. However, given that this is done I'll approve it and see what others think."}, {'account_id': 28008, 'date': '2019-02-18 12:59:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Thanks for this - I don't really understand the change, but trust
 > that you have tested it. To be honest, I think it might be better
 > for us to remove the download of extra packages because these are
 > very dated and I doubt they're maintained. I suspect it may be
 > simpler to have non-x86_64 platforms just use an alternative SST
 > method. However, given that this is done I'll approve it and see
 > what others think.

Thanks jesse. Yeah, I don't like the approach too much too. But it was the only way I found out to fix the issue. In other works we just extract the list of urls/checksums from the dicionary. And as we can't use with_dict and with_items in the same task,I needed to change the item.key to galera_server_percona_distro_packages_alt_arch.keys(0).

This is clearly not extensible so, would be good to follow your approach in the future"}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2019-02-18 14:44:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 28008, 'date': '2019-02-19 11:39:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked

This patchset was cherry picked to branch stable/rocky as commit 714c3473592b0b7a513815ed5361d5d59a576e31'}, {'account_id': 28008, 'date': '2019-02-19 11:41:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked

This patchset was cherry picked to branch stable/queens as commit 85f7b2c1afb312a8bd0a8602d9b5032d4c59953e'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-15 19:10:27.000000000', 'message': 'Iterate over list of values of PPC packages dict

Currently as we are iterating over a higher level dictionary
and it is not possible to access the item.value.url attribute
directly.

Alternatively, we could get the values that is a list and
then iterate over that list to get properly the url and
checksum variables.

Also, we are not iterating over the dictionary we alternatively change
the item.key to galera_server_percona_distro_packages_alt_arch.keys()[0]
that produces the result as item.key.

Change-Id: I3e102377630d9c8ea5c9e3ea03cae3975a05dbb8
Closes-Bug: #1815902
'}]
commit_message:
Iterate over list of values of PPC packages dict

Currently as we are iterating over a higher level dictionary
and it is not possible to access the item.value.url attribute
directly.

Alternatively, we could get the values that is a list and
then iterate over that list to get properly the url and
checksum variables.

Also, we are not iterating over the dictionary we alternatively change
the item.key to galera_server_percona_distro_packages_alt_arch.keys()[0]
that produces the result as item.key.

Change-Id: I3e102377630d9c8ea5c9e3ea03cae3975a05dbb8
Closes-Bug: #1815902

subject: Fixing NTP issues for CDH plugin
messages: [{'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2019-02-19 08:43:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 8932, 'date': '2019-02-19 10:27:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-19 08:43:55.000000000', 'message': "Fixing NTP issues for CDH plugin

First, we are fixing the adding of a new NTP server to ntp.conf.
The way it is currently done the server is added to the end of the
file and we fixed it to add it to the beginning of the config file.
Second, we are changing the order of when we set up ntp and the
service is started, because CDH fails to detect the sync'd time if
it has be synchronized after the start of the service.

Story: #2004981
Task: #29440

Change-Id: Ic2d7697a4036f5f689f065db081d53d4b37532cf
(cherry picked from commit 8f62975a8a84119c79ffdfa42d835665c7eeb515)
"}]
commit_message:
Fixing NTP issues for CDH plugin

First, we are fixing the adding of a new NTP server to ntp.conf.
The way it is currently done the server is added to the end of the
file and we fixed it to add it to the beginning of the config file.
Second, we are changing the order of when we set up ntp and the
service is started, because CDH fails to detect the sync'd time if
it has be synchronized after the start of the service.

Story: #2004981
Task: #29440

Change-Id: Ic2d7697a4036f5f689f065db081d53d4b37532cf
(cherry picked from commit 8f62975a8a84119c79ffdfa42d835665c7eeb515)

'}, {'created': '2019-02-06 21:49:43.000000000', 'message': 'Add policy to create/update public shares

Public shares are visible across all keystone
projects and are "accessible" by all projects
within a multi-tenant cloud. More often than not,
only privileged users can create and manage shares
that EVERYONE on the cloud can really mount and use.

Manila deployers want a way to disable
unprivileged users from create public shares. Feedback
from deployers has been that public shares created on one
private tenant network (DHSS=True scenario) cannot
be used within another private tenant network belonging
to a different project. So, if users unintentionally create
public shares, they end up pollute the dashboards of users
in other projects. So, we need to make public share
creation a "privileged" feature. This can be achieved by
introducing a manila API policy that defaults to
only allowing the "admin" role. So, this commit will:
- Introduce two new policies:
    - share:create_public_share and
    - share:set_public_share
- Set the default check string for these policies
  to rule:admin_api. They will accept the default
  rule temporarily, and log a deprecation warning
  message.
- Remove some redundant policy checks in code
  and move the policy check up in the API so we
  can fail unauthorized requests faster.

When making an API change that potentially changes
the return code from being "successful" (HTTP 2xx)
to returning failure (in this case: HTTP 403,
NotAuthorized), we typically maintain API backwards
compatibility by failing the requests ONLY with newer
API microversions. Following this pattern for API
policy changes will introduce a security hole, i.e.,
users can always create public shares with previous
versions even when an administrator explicitly
sets up policy to disable the action. This is why
this change will not maintain API backwards
compatibility.

APIImpact
Closes-Bug: #1801763
Change-Id: Ib4fc9a82b6a3e5f8e50f0bc8a89d0445eecab028

commit_message:
Add policy to create/update public shares

Public shares are visible across all keystone
projects and are "accessible" by all projects
within a multi-tenant cloud. More often than not,
only privileged users can create and manage shares
that EVERYONE on the cloud can really mount and use.

Manila deployers want a way to disable
unprivileged users from create public shares. Feedback
from deployers has been that public shares created on one
private tenant network (DHSS=True scenario) cannot
be used within another private tenant network belonging
to a different project. So, if users unintentionally create
public shares, they end up pollute the dashboards of users
in other projects. So, we need to make public share
creation a "privileged" feature. This can be achieved by
introducing a manila API policy that defaults to
only allowing the "admin" role. So, this commit will:
- Introduce two new policies:
    - share:create_public_share and
    - share:set_public_share
- Set the default check string for these policies
  to rule:admin_api. They will accept the default
  rule temporarily, and log a deprecation warning
  message.
- Remove some redundant policy checks in code
  and move the policy check up in the API so we
  can fail unauthorized requests faster.

When making an API change that potentially changes
the return code from being "successful" (HTTP 2xx)
to returning failure (in this case: HTTP 403,
NotAuthorized), we typically maintain API backwards
compatibility by failing the requests ONLY with newer
API microversions. Following this pattern for API
policy changes will introduce a security hole, i.e.,
users can always create public shares with previous
versions even when an administrator explicitly
sets up policy to disable the action. This is why
this change will not maintain API backwards
compatibility.

APIImpact
Closes-Bug: #1801763
Change-Id: Ib4fc9a82b6a3e5f8e50f0bc8a89d0445eecab028

commit_message:
Clarify instance state after launch submission

After submitting a launch instance-workflow, an instance is technically
only scheduled for launch - and not yet actually launched.  This patch
reflects this in the message presented in the top right corner.

Closes-Bug: #1287051

Change-Id: Ie86e61c0db561eeb64101c55d304b07191f33ea8
Co-Authored-By: Trygve Vea <trygve.vea@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Return empty list as tuple

Adding a test to the size of the object so that empty lists
keeps the expected behaviour. Also a new test to make sure
that we get no regretions on that subject.

Related-Bug: #1816026

Change-Id: Ie1ed7f9f3b39ac2f94b48b1373c4924d98d81116

subject: Fix how Mistral prepares data for evaluating a YAQL expression
messages:
[{'account_id': 8731, 'date': '2019-02-15 06:08:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 8731, 'date': '2019-02-15 06:10:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Release notes will be cherry-picked from https://review.openstack.org/637127'}, {'account_id': 8731, 'date': '2019-02-18 16:17:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Workflow-1

Let's not merge it for now. We may have to revert the original patch in master because it breaks the case like this:

<% $.my_list != [] %>

i.e. the case when we use a list literal explicitly in YAQL. In this case [] will be internally converted into a tuple and so it will never be equal to any list."}, {'account_id': 8731, 'date': '2019-02-19 10:35:37.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

The initial patch to master had to be reverted.
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/637170/. Read more in the comments of this patch for more details.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-15 06:08:06.000000000', 'message': 'Fix how Mistral prepares data for evaluating a YAQL expression

* If we use the built-in YAQL function 'str' in a workflow then it
  doesn't represent lists as '[item1, item3, ...]' but instead
  creates '(item1, item2,...). This is because the standard YAQL
  function 'yaql_utils.convert_input_data', which is needed to
  convert a initial user data into an internal YAQL format,
  converts all sequences (except strings) into tuples.
  This patch overrides this behavior for sequences that are not
  strings and tuples so that they now get converted into lists.
  YAQL uses tuples because it needs to obtain a safe immutable
  structure to make calculations upon. But in Mistral list is
  more suitable because lots of users care about string
  representations. Immutability is not so important because
  Mistral code base guarantees that the initial data context
  for an expression won't be changed while an expression is
  being evaluated by YAQL.
* "str" YAQL function used to work well but it was broken in
  https://review.openstack.org/#/c/477816/ that added additional
  context preparation in order to fix the issue
  https://bugs.launchpad.net/mistral/+bug/1772864

Change-Id: I69d32f8772418d586d6c414842bb54aada217481
Closes-Bug: #1815710
(cherry picked from commit a39db2d3dc21afbe8b9e1d6f8dd870da272b9671)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix how Mistral prepares data for evaluating a YAQL expression

* If we use the built-in YAQL function 'str' in a workflow then it
  doesn't represent lists as '[item1, item3, ...]' but instead
  creates '(item1, item2,...). This is because the standard YAQL
  function 'yaql_utils.convert_input_data', which is needed to
  convert a initial user data into an internal YAQL format,
  converts all sequences (except strings) into tuples.
  This patch overrides this behavior for sequences that are not
  strings and tuples so that they now get converted into lists.
  YAQL uses tuples because it needs to obtain a safe immutable
  structure to make calculations upon. But in Mistral list is
  more suitable because lots of users care about string
  representations. Immutability is not so important because
  Mistral code base guarantees that the initial data context
  for an expression won't be changed while an expression is
  being evaluated by YAQL.
* "str" YAQL function used to work well but it was broken in
  https://review.openstack.org/#/c/477816/ that added additional
  context preparation in order to fix the issue
  https://bugs.launchpad.net/mistral/+bug/1772864

Change-Id: I69d32f8772418d586d6c414842bb54aada217481
Closes-Bug: #1815710
(cherry picked from commit a39db2d3dc21afbe8b9e1d6f8dd870da272b9671)

commit_message:
Only request neutron certificate from neutron dhcp service

The certificate request for the "neutron" certificate was set in the
neutron base template. This had the secondary effect of causing every
node that has a neutron service to try to request the certificate.

This fixes that issue by moving those bits to where the certificate is
actually used (which is only by the dhcp agent).

Change-Id: I10ade8a4b5ec30872210c633d35273309ae20377
Closes-Bug: #1816465

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 7708, 'name': 'Sergey Vilgelm', 'username': 'svilgelm', 'inactive': True}, {'_account_id': 8911, 'name': 'Sergey Vilgelm', 'email': 'sergey@vilgelm.info', 'username': 'sergey.vilgelm'}, {'_account_id': 16274, 'name': 'Mykola Yakovliev', 'email': 'VegasQ@gmail.com', 'username': 'vegasq'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23186, 'name': 'Felipe Monteiro', 'email': 'felipe.carneiro.monteiro@gmail.com', 'username': 'felipe.monteiro'}, {'_account_id': 27977, 'name': 'Lakshmi Prasanna Goutham Pratapa', 'email': 'lakshmi.pratapa@imaginea.com', 'username': 'pratapagoutham'}, {'_account_id': 29868, 'name': 'Mykola Yakovliev', 'email': 'my5878@att.com'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 29397, 'date': '2019-02-12 16:05:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 8911, 'date': '2019-02-12 16:19:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

from my point of view if you want to run Patrole against different sets of roles, you need to run it  in a row.
Use a bash script:
crudini --set /etc/tempest.conf patrole rbac_test_roles member,reader
tempest run --regex patrole

crudini --set /etc/tempest.conf patrole rbac_test_roles admin
tempest run --regex patrole'}, {'account_id': 23186, 'date': '2019-02-12 16:47:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

I agree with Sergey. This behavior can easily be achieved via a simple shell script. This functionality is undesirable because it leads to a situation where there is no easily discernible test isolation for each role. This is like trying to run each Tempest test using dynamic credentials and pre-provisioned credentials back to back rather than having an isolated test run for each.

Besides that, this is now copying the behavior of https://github.com/rlrossiter/cinnamon-role and one of the reasons why Patrole was made was to account for design flaws like this.'}, {'account_id': 29397, 'date': '2019-02-19 10:28:35.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

undesirable approach'}]

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-07 14:54:33.000000000', 'message': "glance, designate: Correctly match hostnames

'in' expresion matches substrings, therefore it is possible
that following expression will fail:
    inventory_hostname in groups[service.group][0]
for example when:
    inventory_hostname = 'my-host-a'
    groups[service.group][0] = 'my-host-a1'

The result is running task on multiple hosts rather than single one.
Such action might result in playbook failure

Change-Id: Ibe2d5ca2f9502a8140a895ab3ac7abc5076ce2ff
Signed-off-by: Maciej Kucia <m.kucia@partner.samsung.com>

commit_message:
designate: Correctly match hostnames

'in' expresion matches substrings, therefore it is possible
that following expression will fail:
    inventory_hostname in groups['groupname'][0]
for example when:
    inventory_hostname = 'my-host-a'
    groups['groupname'][0] = 'my-host-a1'

The result is running task on multiple hosts rather than single one.
Such action might result in playbook failure

Change-Id: Ibe2d5ca2f9502a8140a895ab3ac7abc5076ce2ff
Signed-off-by: Maciej Kucia <m.kucia@partner.samsung.com>

commit_message:
Update pool creation for >= Jewel

The ceph broker request missed some pools for later Ceph versions,
and created pools which where no longer required.

Update pool list and tweak weights inline with current best practice.

Change-Id: I4ed7e08d557c33a05aa8f8c6305914ef9734bad6
Closes-Bug: 1685536

commit_message:
Keep git after ironic-agent post

New versions of pbr depends on git [1] and IPA depends on pbr [2] so
removing git will remove pbr, IPA and friends.

[1] https://src.fedoraproject.org/rpms/python-pbr/blob/master/f/python-pbr.spec#_64
[2] https://github.com/rdo-packages/ironic-python-agent-distgit/blob/rpm-master/openstack-ironic-python-agent.spec#L85

Closes-Bug: #1816017
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/637668
Change-Id: I97f6b593e88e1cb81cd4bb2d77787bc012fb8271

commit_message:
Adds masakari api support service catalog

Masakari for instance HA needs to be added to the keystone service
catalog for functionality of the upcoming masakari charms

Change-Id: Ic48767df7dc0408679c7dd9a6d7547b744778894

commit_message:
Nova-compatible console log for Ironic

This proposes adding new API to Ironic and an implementation to
Socat console for providing Nova-compatible serial console log.

Change-Id: I781be7b210641df518b5c4bdcd9ee7ed8d75171a
Closes-bug: #1526368

  $ cd ~/networking-ovn

4. Run the test_models_sync() functional test:

commit_message:
Fix test_models_sync() functional test

This patch is fixing the test_models_sync() test from oslo.db by removing
the inconsistencies from the models.py module and the migration script
for the ovn_revision_numbers table.

Note that this test doesn't current run in our gate, it gets skipped
because the databases are not properly configured when setting up the
functional tests. For now, it's possible to configure mysql by hand to
test this patch by doing the following:

1. Stack DevStack as per our documentation

2. Configure Mysql:

  $ cat << EOF > /tmp/mysql.sql
  CREATE DATABASE openstack_citest;
  CREATE USER 'openstack_citest'@'localhost' IDENTIFIED BY
  'openstack_citest';
  CREATE USER 'openstack_citest' IDENTIFIED BY 'openstack_citest';
  GRANT ALL PRIVILEGES ON *.* TO 'openstack_citest'@'localhost';
  GRANT ALL PRIVILEGES ON *.* TO 'openstack_citest';
  FLUSH PRIVILEGES;
  EOF

  $ /usr/bin/mysql -u root < /tmp/mysql.sql

3. Change to the networking-ovn directory

  $ cd ~/networking-ovn

4. Run the test_models_sync() functional test:

  $ tox -edsvm-functional TestModelsMigrationsMysql.test_models_sync

Partial-Bug: #1766639
Change-Id: Ie3b600d4f3d7a3d594685848f35868c438f20976
(cherry picked from commit b892650a6e62ac71679409cac767b58d867021bf)

commit_message:
Properly configure the environment for functional tests

This patch is configuring the functional tests environment so we can
also run the database migration tests.

The patch includes a new script at tools/configure_for_func_testing.sh
which runs as part of the gate_hook.sh for the dsvm-functional tests and
is responsible for installing and configuring the environment.

Closes-Bug: #1766639
Change-Id: I0df72a17f78c011d68ae5662e8550ce7714c1680
(cherry picked from commit 77a38a1ce7d85e872ef1967831cb24863dbdfc0a)

[{'created': '2019-01-23 19:09:06.000000000', 'message': "Always write/setup AppArmor profile in config-changed

Prior to this change the AppArmor profile for /usr/bin/ceph-osd was
always written when config-changed was executed, however, it was only
setup on the first install or when the aa-profile-mode config option
changed. This led to an unintended side-effect as descibed in the
corresponding bug. Let's just write and setup the profile on every
config-changed hook like we do for rendered config files.

Change-Id: Ic6110a31efc471bfd7c323effbf1e32654c7666e
Closes-Bug: #1783373
"}]
commit_message:
Always write/setup AppArmor profile in config-changed

Prior to this change the AppArmor profile for /usr/bin/ceph-osd was
always written when config-changed was executed, however, it was only
setup on the first install or when the aa-profile-mode config option
changed. This led to an unintended side-effect as descibed in the
corresponding bug. Let's just write and setup the profile on every
config-changed hook like we do for rendered config files.

Change-Id: Ic6110a31efc471bfd7c323effbf1e32654c7666e
Closes-Bug: #1783373

commit_message:
Only init a workspace if doesn't exists

The fix workspace path[1] executes the init
regardless, but to make it work in an upgrade
from rocky to queens we should just move the path
of an existent workspace

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/627782/

Change-Id: I9bdea50be389815f3e8dbe6a42e7628f7b40f9b6

subject: Add spec for incorporating oslo config migration in Kolla-ansible
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 14826, 'name': 'Mark Goddard', 'email': 'mark@stackhpc.com', 'username': 'mgoddard'}, {'_account_id': 19853, 'name': 'Nguyen Hung Phuong', 'email': 'phuongnh@vn.fujitsu.com', 'username': 'phuongnh'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23717, 'name': 'Surya Prakash Singh', 'email': 'singh.surya64mnnit@gmail.com', 'username': 'SuryaPrakash'}, {'_account_id': 28176, 'name': 'Ha Manh Dong', 'email': 'donghm@viettel.com.vn', 'username': 'donghm'}, {'_account_id': 28614, 'name': 'jacky06', 'email': 'zhang.min@99cloud.net', 'username': 'jacky06'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 18320, 'date': '2018-09-10 20:56:02.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 23717, 'date': '2018-09-17 10:03:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(6 comments)'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2018-09-18 14:06:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

In the discussion at the PTG [1] I made some suggestions which I think are wrong. I didn't realise that the source code for the service being upgraded needs to be available, which seems obvious now.

So, this means we can't do config migration in the merge_configs ansible module. We need to generate config for every host, then execute the config migration script for the service (I assume each service will have its own script entry point?) in a container. We would need a way of extracting the config migrations from the container, this could be by bind mounting in an output directory, or perhaps grabbing output from the container's stdout.

We'd still end up with a large number of migrations (one for every service on every host), and would probably need some way to make sense of this.

I'd like to see some more detail in this spec, and more of a step-by-step breakdown of exactly how the procedure will work.

[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/kolla-stein-ptg-fast-forward-upgrade"}, {'account_id': 28614, 'date': '2018-09-20 15:48:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

> (6 comments)'}, {'account_id': 18320, 'date': '2019-02-19 09:12:02.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

[{'created': '2018-09-10 20:56:02.000000000', 'message': 'Add spec for incorporating oslo config migration in Kolla-ansible

Two of the most important and challenging requirements in OpenStack
upgrading are database migration and configuration migration. Database
igration has been done by service itself and already implemented in Kolla
but nothing for configuration migration.

Configuration migration is implemented partially in Oslo [1] and we
should apply it in Kolla.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/520043/

Change-Id: I4fa330eee2345673ea8482c2d1e7dd913bb4c7fd
Implements: blueprint incorporate-oslo-config-migration-in-kolla-ansible
'}]
commit_message:
Add spec for incorporating oslo config migration in Kolla-ansible

Two of the most important and challenging requirements in OpenStack
upgrading are database migration and configuration migration. Database
igration has been done by service itself and already implemented in Kolla
but nothing for configuration migration.

Configuration migration is implemented partially in Oslo [1] and we
should apply it in Kolla.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/520043/

Change-Id: I4fa330eee2345673ea8482c2d1e7dd913bb4c7fd
Implements: blueprint incorporate-oslo-config-migration-in-kolla-ansible

subject: Fix image generation for ambari plugin on Ubuntu
messages:
[{'account_id': 29051, 'date': '2018-12-07 15:35:50.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 29051, 'date': '2018-12-07 17:36:58.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2018-12-11 09:34:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

check experimental'}, {'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2018-12-11 12:08:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

check experimental'}, {'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2018-12-12 12:17:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

No regressions on centos/RHEL images.

I tried to generate an ubuntu 16.04 image and I get the following error when starting it:

    Details: Cluster in Error state with a message below:
    Creating cluster failed for the following reason(s): RemoteCommandException: Error during command execution: "ambari-server setup -s -j `cut -f2 -d "=" /etc/profile.d/99-java.sh`"
    Return code: 2
    STDERR:
    cut: /etc/profile.d/99-java.sh: No such file or directory
    Usage: ambari-server.py [options] action [stack_id os]
    
    ambari-server.py: error: -j option requires an argument'}, {'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2018-12-13 12:29:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

There is another complication: Ambari 2.6 (which can spawn HDP 2.6, 2.4 and 2.4) can use 16.04, so openjdk 1.8, while Ambari 2.4, used for HDP 2.3, supports only 14.04, so openjdk 1.7.

Maybe you want to declare support only for one of them, but most likely centos/setup_java_home should be copied to ubuntu/ and adapted accordingly.'}, {'account_id': 29051, 'date': '2018-12-18 20:47:29.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2018-12-18 22:28:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

check experimental'}, {'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2018-12-20 10:43:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2

It works. I can generated an HDP 2.6 cluster based on xenial when applying this patch (both to sahara-image-pack and to the running services).

There is just an issue with starting Hive because libmysql-java is removed by sahara; see resolve_package_conflicts from sahara/plugins/ambari/deploy.py. It seems an old conflict which may not be relevant anymore for newer versions of Ambari and HDP, but it's not a regression introduced by this review and it will probably require more work."}, {'account_id': 23078, 'date': '2019-01-02 16:53:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2

Looks good.

Seeing as there was previously so much wrong with the image, is it worth a release note (in a follow-up patch) to be clear that things work now?'}, {'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2019-02-06 11:32:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Nicolas, I apologize for the delay: your patch ended up in the middle of the split, so now it should be sent to sahara-plugin-ambari. Could you please send it? Unfortunately gerrit cannot retarget a review to a different repository, if I remember correctly.
Once merged, I will make sure to backport it to the stable branches of sahara.git.'}, {'account_id': 23078, 'date': '2019-02-08 19:20:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: -Code-Review'}, {'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2019-02-19 09:02:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: -Code-Review'}, {'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2019-02-19 09:03:11.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

The patch itself cannot be merged as it is after that plugins have been split. It was superseded by https://review.openstack.org/#/c/635558/ (sahara-plugin-ambari, master) and https://review.openstack.org/#/c/623289/ (stable/rocky backport, other backports may follow.)'}]

commit_message:
Update v3 identity group tests to work w/ pre-prov

I don't see any limitations by using pre-provisioned
credentials for these tests:

* test_group_create_update_get
* test_group_users_add_list_delete
* test_list_user_groups
* test_list_groups

Change-Id: Id22911035ce880ab1faa9b37b238b9372ae98087

commit_message:
Ensure kuryr-controller recover from lb in ERROR status

This patch ensures kuryr controller can recover from the situation
when the created lb goes into ERROR status (instead of ACTIVE). Now,
when the kuryr-controller finds the created lb, it checks its
provisioning_status and if in ERROR status it will delete it and
ensure a ResourceNotReady exception is triggered so that a new
creation action is triggered after the deletion of the lb in ERROR
status.

Closes-Bug: 1815880
Change-Id: I3f5de710a5ff37dee05f5f8826cb37c343141a08

commit_message:
Replace mock.has_calls() with assert_has_calls

mock object has no has_calls() method, but assert_has_calls().
This patch fixes some misuses of this method.

Change-Id: If2795ebe8d4893d9f99e5e82732757d08cc27237

commit_message:
Fix cluster recovery and node recovery params

- Make 'operation' param in cluster recovery and node recovery a
  string.
- Add 'operation_params' for cluster recovery and node recovery to pass
  in extra parameters like reboot type.
- Add type validation checks for cluster recovery and node recovery
  parameters.

Change-Id: I73600991f97d5700d3eac442b4785f653ba4820f
Closes-Bug: #1815540

commit_message:
Check required health policy version

Only run health policy tests if version 1.1 is supported by.  This is
needed to allow tempest tests to run correctly against older releases of
senlin.

[{'created': '2018-10-12 05:25:45.000000000', 'message': 'Add note for sending SIGHUP at rolling upgrade steps

As response from the deployment team at Fujitsu,
at step 3. After maintenance window, if sending SIGHUP
to the console proxy services will cause them to stop.
This patch adds a note for that.

Change-Id: I700e7696f59c58ed8d4900b7457f0251ba836d29
'}]
commit_message:
Add note for sending SIGHUP at rolling upgrade steps

As response from the deployment team at Fujitsu,
at step 3. After maintenance window, if sending SIGHUP
to the console proxy services will cause them to stop.
This patch adds a note for that.

Change-Id: I700e7696f59c58ed8d4900b7457f0251ba836d29

commit_message:
Fix gate issues on master

We recently removed nenutron.common.rpc [1] as the rpc module lives in
neutron-lib now. This project was missed because I didn't find
neutron.common.rpc as an import. This patch switches rpc uses over to
neutron-lib.

This also addresses an issue where toxenv fails when it encounters a
non-empty __pycache__ directory. This adjusts the options passed to
find so that it is tolerant of this scenario and allows tox runs to
proceed.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/634790/

Change-Id: Ice83f7574f146436e3db045693b530f0cfeda049

commit_message:
db sync prints stack-trace on invalid version

nova-manage db sync command prints stack-trace along with valid
error message if non-existing version information is passed.
Ideally it should just print the user friendly error message.

Change-Id: Ide36a25d33d8e7fb60443d9eb871f73e2085613f
Closes-Bug: #1815726

commit_message:
Use private IP for supplemental node

When connecting to supplemental node use private IP
as it's only available in this step.

Change-Id: I1e57b9fe823263caa15522e84bf9482b5c47491b

commit_message:
Set container_binary to podman from stein releases onwards

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/608452/ Switch the undercloud to
deploy Podman by default starting from Stein and
undercloud_container_cli var is setted under undercloud_deploy role
and it cannot be used in another role which will set
container_binary to docker but docker is not there in stein leading
to fail running tempest from container.

Use sudo while pulling tempest using podman

Change-Id: I7ee75d71a7c34bdb85232a1378880ff16579c5db
Related-Bug: #1816026
